intro: Kyrsteniopsis perpetiolata, commonly known as the evergreen kyrsteniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
